This problem occurs every time a commons-logging.1.0.4.jar is in the classpath.
This jar is provided either by hibernate-tools-plugin or org.apache.batik.pdf_1.6.0.v20060613-1220.
The latter one is even more confusing since the class org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Log4JLogger is
contained inside the jar lib\pdf-transcoder.jar.
If we remove the hibernate-plugins and org.apache.batik.pdf_1.6.0.v20060613-1220 everything works
fine. Checking with the jvm-option -verbose:class reveals that instead of Log4JLogger now Jdk14Logger
is beeing loaded from:
Loaded org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger from file:/C:/dev/eclipse-SDK-3.2-win32/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.tomcat_4.1.130.v20060601/commons-logging-api.jar]
This only happens when our own plugins reference log4j.

We have several questions:

1. Why are classes of commons-logging bundled in the jars:
org.eclipse.tomcat_4.1.130.v20060601/commons-logging-api.jar
org.apache.batik.pdf_1.6.0.v20060613-1220/lib\pdf-transcoder.jar
This makes it very difficult to write plugins.

2. Is there a way of keeping the above plugins since we need both birt and hibernate-plugins.

Any help on this is highly appreciated.

Regards,
Peter Fopma
Barthel Steckemetz

cc Sheldon on the question of 

"The latter one is even more confusing since the class
org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Log4JLogger is
contained inside the jar lib\pdf-transcoder.jar."

As a work around for now, you can remove org.apache.batik.pdf_1.6.0.v20060613-1220.  This plugin is for generating PDF from chart when chart is not used inside a report.  Unless you are using chart engine independently, you can safely remove this plugin.

As for the class conflict between the hibernate plugin and the commons-logging.1.0.4.jar  on the class path.  Do you want to try remove the commons-logging.1.0.4.jar  in the hibernate-tools-plugin but keeping the rest of the plugin?

But in general, Eclipse's OSGi framework need to find a way to resolve class conflicts among plugins and class on the class path.    Please post a question in the Equinox project's news group or log a bugzilla for this project.

The pdftranscoder.jar released by batik does contain the common logging classes.   Wenfeng is correct... the org.apache.batik.pdf_1.6.0.v20060613-1220 plugin is only needed by the Chart Engine in stand alone mode.   For your case you don't need this plugin.

Thanks Sheldon,
this would be another workaround.
In my previous posting I desribed that the 
ViewerClassLoaderWrapper may be using a wrong classloading
strategy. Is this right ? Because this may be the root cause
for our problems and would be for a lot of further problems.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Thanks Sheldon,
> this would be another workaround.
> In my previous posting I desribed that the 
> ViewerClassLoaderWrapper may be using a wrong classloading
> strategy. Is this right ? Because this may be the root cause
> for our problems and would be for a lot of further problems.

I think you are right that fixing the class loading issue could prevent other potential class conflicts.

(In reply to comment #5)
> I think you are right that fixing the class loading issue could prevent other
> potential class conflicts.   
> 

I can provide a simple test case if you like.

Do you put the log4j.jar in Tomcat's classpath, or put it in your class path?
Could you provide the fail case?
If it's in the tomcat's classpath, the fail is not related to that class loading code even we need fix that code also.

(In reply to comment #7)
> Do you put the log4j.jar in Tomcat's classpath, or put it in your class path?

No its not in tomcats classpath its contained in our own plugin

> Could you provide the fail case?

I will do so in the next days.

> If it's in the tomcat's classpath, the fail is not related to that class
> loading code even we need fix that code also.

Fixing this would really help us.

Is this issue only related to the birt designer?  I am wondering if the org.apache.batik.pdf should be packaged in the birt designer since this plugin is only useful when using the charts in standalone mode.  It's not needed in cases where the report engine uses the chart engine.  

The org.apache.batik.pdf plugin should be packaged in the chart engine driver (i.e. birt-charts-2_1_0.zip).

(In reply to comment #9)
> Is this issue only related to the birt designer?  I am wondering if the
> org.apache.batik.pdf should be packaged in the birt designer since this plugin
> is only useful when using the charts in standalone mode.  It's not needed in
> cases where the report engine uses the chart engine.  
> The org.apache.batik.pdf plugin should be packaged in the chart engine driver
> (i.e. birt-charts-2_1_0.zip).

I think there is feature dependency of chart to this plugin, if we remove this plugin from the designer packate, Eclipse update manager will give error.

It would be better to fix the code in the designer's class loader wrapper to avoid other potential class conflicts.
